ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Chains Reliability
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yes, but keep in mind if you re in a party of 5-6 and distributing the damage relatively evenly, you re healing 165 or 198 points per tick.  Lately, a lot
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 21 Mar 2000, JasonF wrote:
>
> CoC + CoD + Niv + Hymn =
> (m-50) + (m-17) + (p+14) + (p+19) =
>
> -67 to m and + 33 to p. (with some estimated numbers)
>
> That's definitely non-trivial dmg, but as you know the mobs we fight at our
> level routinely hit even the tanks in excess of 33 dmg. Hell it's three to
> five times that. So while the healing is nice, it's obviously not a
> substite for someone dressed like a grape. Although it might let ya solo a
> couple of SKs, that's true.

Yes, but keep in mind if you're in a party of 5-6 and
distributing the damage relatively evenly, you're healing 165
or 198 points per tick. Lately, a lot of the fights I've been
in (Sol B and LGuk), the cleric has been superfluous, and
started nuking for lack of something better to do with all
that mana.

> I'll have to try this attack method, however, I'm on analog modem and PII
> 400. Weaving three songs is normally pretty easy, but four leaves
> significant gaps. In the planes and dragons forget it - two is a struggle.
> Speaking of the planes I don't think I'll be singing CoD/CoC with a lute up
> there. :-)

I've been too chicken to try. :)

I'm pretty sure our DoTs are 3 pulses, not 2 like our other
songs. So Hymn, Niv's, CoC, Hymn, Niv's, CoD, repeat is only
slightly less efficient.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
